skills.name: HTML
skills.text: HTML is the standard markup language for creating web pages. It describes the structure of a web page semantically and consists of a series of elements that define different parts of a document.

skills.name: css
skills.text: CSS is a style sheet language used for describing the look and formatting of a document written in HTML. It controls the visual presentation of a web page, including layout, colors, and fonts.

skills.name: Bootstrap
skills.text: Bootstrap is a popular CSS framework that simplifies the process of building responsive and mobile-first websites. It includes a set of predefined styles and components that can be easily customized.

skills.name: Tailwind
skills.text: Tailwind CSS is a utility-first CSS framework that provides low-level utility classes to build designs directly in your markup. It offers a highly customizable and flexible approach to styling web applications.

skills.name: JavaScript
skills.text: JavaScript is a high-level, interpreted programming language. It is the scripting language for web pages and provides dynamic and interactive content. JavaScript is widely used for client-side development in web browsers.

skills.name: TypeScript
skills.text: TypeScript is a superset of JavaScript that adds static typing to the language. It enhances code maintainability and developer productivity by catching errors during development. TypeScript is often used in large-scale applications.

skills.name: React
skills.text: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces. It allows developers to create reusable UI components and build complex UIs efficiently. React is widely used for building single-page applications (SPAs) and is maintained by Facebook.

skills.name: Next
skills.text: Next.js is a React framework for building server-rendered React applications. It provides a great developer experience with features like automatic code splitting, server-side rendering, and a powerful plugin system.

skills.name: MongoDB
skills.text: MongoDB is a NoSQL database that stores data in flexible, JSON-like documents. It is designed for scalability, flexibility, and high performance. MongoDB is commonly used in modern web development for handling large amounts of data.

skills.name: Express
skills.text: Express.js is a minimal and flexible Node.js web application framework. It provides a robust set of features for web and mobile applications. Express.js is widely used for building RESTful APIs and web applications.

skills.name: Node
skills.text: Node.js is a runtime environment that allows you to run JavaScript on the server side. It is designed for building scalable network applications and is widely used for creating server-side applications, APIs, and microservices.
